intro: Tithymalus henryi, commonly known as the Chinese tithymalus, is a flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley. The plant features small, yellowish-white flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. Its leaves are pinnately divided, contributing to its ornamental appeal. Tithymalus henryi is often cultivated for its delicate appearance and historical use in traditional medicine.
